episodeTitleJapanese: 海賊貴公子 キャベンディッシュ
description: Luffy encounters the beautiful pirate prince Cavendish at the Corrida Colosseum, who reveals his grudge against the Worst Generation. Rebecca tells Luffy about the legendary gladiator Kyros. The announcer reveals that Jesus Burgess of the Blackbeard Pirates has won Block A.

events.title: Cavendish's Grand Entrance
events.description: The famous beautiful pirate Cavendish makes his first full appearance at the Corrida Colosseum, immediately drawing attention from spectators and fellow gladiators. He encounters Luffy (disguised as Lucy) and doesn't recognize him.
events.significance: Introduces one of the most important allies in the Dressrosa Arc and future member of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet. Cavendish's character and his grudge against the Worst Generation become central to the arc's dynamics.

quotes.text: I am Cavendish of the White Horse, the pirate prince!
quotes.speaker: Cavendish

events.title: Cavendish's Grudge Against the Worst Generation
events.description: Cavendish reveals to Luffy that three years ago, he was a rising star pirate whose fame was suddenly overshadowed when the Eleven Supernovas arrived at Sabaody Archipelago. He declares his intention to kill them all for stealing his spotlight.
events.significance: Provides crucial context for Cavendish's motivations and creates dramatic irony as he doesn't realize he's speaking to one of the Supernovas. This grudge becomes a recurring theme until Cavendish eventually joins Luffy's Grand Fleet.

quotes.text: Three years ago, my name was on everyone's lips! But then those eleven rookies appeared and stole my spotlight!
quotes.speaker: Cavendish
quotes.context: Cavendish explaining his hatred for the Worst Generation

events.title: Farul Appears in Flashback
events.description: Cavendish's loyal white horse Farul appears in a flashback showing Cavendish's past as a famous pirate before the Worst Generation's arrival.
events.significance: Introduces Farul, Cavendish's faithful companion who will play a role in later battles during the Dressrosa Arc.

events.title: The Legend of Kyros the Undefeated
events.description: Luffy stares in awe at a massive bronze statue of a gladiator. Rebecca appears and explains that the statue depicts Kyros, a legendary gladiator who won 3,000 consecutive matches at the Corrida Colosseum without ever losing. She mentions he disappeared 20 years ago.
events.significance: Plants the seeds for one of the Dressrosa Arc's most emotional storylines. The mystery of Kyros and his connection to Rebecca becomes central to understanding Dressrosa's tragic history under Doflamingo's rule. The reveal that Kyros was turned into a toy is one of the arc's biggest twists.

quotes.text: That's the statue of Kyros the Undefeated. He won 3,000 battles in a row without a single loss!
quotes.speaker: Rebecca
quotes.context: Rebecca explaining the legend to Luffy

events.title: Rebecca's Introduction
events.description: Rebecca, a female gladiator competing in the tournament, introduces herself to Luffy. She appears as a kind and knowledgeable person who shares information about the Colosseum's history.
events.significance: Rebecca becomes one of the central characters of the Dressrosa Arc. Her connection to Kyros, King Riku, and the truth about Dressrosa's past makes her crucial to the storyline. She represents the innocence crushed by Doflamingo's tyranny.

events.title: Vice Admiral Maynard's Debut
events.description: Vice Admiral Maynard the Pursuer is shown undercover at the Colosseum as the contestant 'Capman', listing wanted pirates present to gather intelligence for the Marines.
events.significance: Reveals that the Marines have infiltrated the tournament, showing the strategic importance of the Mera Mera no Mi and the gathering of dangerous pirates. Maynard's later defeat by Bartolomeo demonstrates the overwhelming power of the new generation.

events.title: Gambia's Debut
events.description: Gambia, staff officer of the Barto Club, makes his debut as a competitor in the Colosseum tournament. He is shown being easily defeated by the undercover Marine Maynard.
events.significance: Introduces Gambia as a member of Bartolomeo's crew. His presence foreshadows Bartolomeo's participation and eventual victory in Block B. He later becomes part of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet.

events.title: Jesus Burgess Wins Block A
events.description: The announcer reveals that Block A's battle royale has concluded. The mysterious winner removes the paper bag from his head and reveals himself to be Jesus Burgess, the Champion and captain of the first ship of the Blackbeard Pirates. He gestures triumphantly over the broken bodies of his defeated opponents.
events.significance: Marks the first post-timeskip appearance of a Blackbeard Pirates commander and reveals Blackbeard's interest in the Mera Mera no Mi. This raises the stakes of the tournament significantly and foreshadows future conflicts between the Blackbeard Pirates and Luffy's allies. Burgess's presence shows how dangerous the competition has become.

quotes.text: Wiiihahaha! This is the power of the Blackbeard Pirates!
quotes.speaker: Jesus Burgess
quotes.context: Burgess celebrating his victory in Block A

events.title: Bellamy Confronts Luffy
events.description: Bellamy walks up behind Luffy backstage, revealing he can see through Luffy's disguise. He tells Luffy he is no longer the man from Jaya and went to a sky island at the cost of his crew. Bellamy declares there is no bad blood between them and that he only wants to join Doflamingo's crew.
events.significance: Reunites two characters from the Jaya Arc and shows Bellamy's character development. His changed attitude toward Luffy and sky islands demonstrates growth, but his continued loyalty to Doflamingo sets up tragic events later. This encounter adds emotional weight to the Dressrosa Arc's themes of dreams and loyalty.

quotes.text: I'm nothing like the man you fought in Jaya. I went to a sky island, Straw Hat, at the cost of my crew.
quotes.speaker: Bellamy
quotes.context: Bellamy revealing his transformation to Luffy

events.title: Bellamy Enters Block B
events.description: As Bellamy walks into the arena for Block B, the announcer reveals that if he wins the tournament, he will be promoted to a high executive position in the Donquixote Family, showing his motivation for competing.
events.significance: Establishes Bellamy's stake in the tournament and his desperate desire to earn Doflamingo's approval. This motivation drives his actions throughout the arc and sets up his eventual tragic confrontation with Doflamingo, highlighting the themes of misplaced loyalty.

quotes.text: I am Cavendish of the White Horse, the pirate prince!
quotes.speaker: Cavendish

quotes.text: Three years ago, my name was on everyone's lips! But then those eleven rookies appeared and stole my spotlight!
quotes.speaker: Cavendish
quotes.context: Explaining his grudge against the Worst Generation

quotes.text: That's the statue of Kyros the Undefeated. He won 3,000 battles in a row without a single loss!
quotes.speaker: Rebecca
quotes.context: Telling Luffy about the legendary gladiator

quotes.text: Wiiihahaha! This is the power of the Blackbeard Pirates!
quotes.speaker: Jesus Burgess

quotes.text: I'm nothing like the man you fought in Jaya. I went to a sky island, Straw Hat, at the cost of my crew.
quotes.speaker: Bellamy

themes.description: Cavendish's grudge against the Worst Generation highlights how the pursuit of fame can consume a person. His obsession with being in the spotlight contrasts with Luffy's indifference to recognition.
themes.symbolism: Cavendish represents the vanity of fame, while Luffy's disguise shows he cares only about his goal (the Mera Mera no Mi), not public adoration.

themes.description: The statue of Kyros represents how legends endure even when the person is forgotten. This theme becomes crucial as the arc reveals how Doflamingo erased Kyros from memory by turning him into a toy.
themes.symbolism: The bronze statue stands as physical proof of Kyros's achievements even though no one remembers him as a person, foreshadowing the toy curse revelation.

themes.description: Bellamy's character arc shows genuine personal growth. He went from mocking dreams to pursuing the sky island dream himself, though his loyalty to Doflamingo remains his tragic flaw.
themes.symbolism: Bellamy going to Sky Island at the cost of his crew shows he learned the importance of dreams, but his continued devotion to Doflamingo shows incomplete growth.

themes.description: Multiple factions (Marines, Blackbeard Pirates, Revolutionary Army) have infiltrated the tournament with secret motives beyond winning the Mera Mera no Mi.
themes.symbolism: The Colosseum becomes a microcosm of the larger power struggles in the One Piece world.

characterSpotlights.development: Cavendish is established as a narcissistic but skilled swordsman with a deep grudge against the Worst Generation. His beautiful appearance and prideful personality make him both comedic and threatening.
keyActions: Explains his grudge to Luffy without recognizing him
Demonstrates his narcissism and obsession with fame
quotes: I am Cavendish of the White Horse, the pirate prince!
Three years ago, my name was on everyone's lips!

characterSpotlights.development: Rebecca is introduced as a knowledgeable and kind gladiator who shares the legend of Kyros with Luffy, hinting at her deeper connection to Dressrosa's history.
keyActions: Tells the legend of Kyros the Undefeated
Shows respect for the Colosseum's history
quotes: That's the statue of Kyros the Undefeated. He won 3,000 battles in a row without a single loss!

characterSpotlights.development: Burgess's victory in Block A establishes him as a formidable threat and reveals the Blackbeard Pirates' interest in obtaining Ace's former Devil Fruit power.
keyActions: Reveals his identity to the shocked crowd
quotes: Wiiihahaha! This is the power of the Blackbeard Pirates!

characterSpotlights.development: Bellamy shows significant character growth from his Jaya Arc appearance, having pursued the sky island dream he once mocked. However, his loyalty to Doflamingo remains unchanged.
keyActions: Reveals his journey to Sky Island
Declares no bad blood with Luffy
quotes: I'm nothing like the man you fought in Jaya. I went to a sky island, Straw Hat, at the cost of my crew.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended several scenes at the Colosseum to show more of the atmosphere and spectators, padding the runtime.
Additional reaction shots from background characters were added when Jesus Burgess revealed his identity.

trivia.fact: Episode 634 adapts content from three manga chapters (704-706), specifically pages 10-19 of Chapter 704, pages 2-7 of Chapter 705, and pages 6-7 of Chapter 706.
Cavendish is voiced by Akira Ishida in Japanese, who is known for voicing other beautiful and narcissistic characters in anime.
This episode marks Jesus Burgess's first appearance after the two-year timeskip, revealing he has gained significant power and position within the Blackbeard Pirates.
The legend of Kyros winning 3,000 consecutive matches makes him one of the most successful gladiators in One Piece world history.
Opening theme 'Wake up!' by AAA features dialogue from Blackbeard spoken in the middle of the song, creating a unique opening sequence.
